special_features: Commentary by Tom Baker, Mary Tamm, and Anthony Read

notes: Douglas Adams' first contribution to Doctor Who.
Part of the Key to Time arc.
Adams was concurrently working on The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy radio series at the time.
Had working titles: 'The Pirates' and 'The Perfect Planet'.

in_universe_mythology: Queen Xanxia and the Time Dams
real_world_cultural_references: Parody of Captain Hook from Peter Pan
Reference to Isaac Newton and theory of gravity
Hint of Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

continuity_notes: The Doctor refers to previous companion Leela.
The Seventh Doctor recalls being on Zanak in 1978 in a later story.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor and Romana, seeking the second segment of the Key to Time, arrive on the hollowed-out planet Zanak rather than Calufrax. They discover that Zanak, controlled by the half-robot Captain, jumps through space to encapsulate other planets and absorb their resources. The mentally affected native Pralix is taken by the telepathic Mentiads. As the Doctor navigates the Captain's operations, he learns of Queen Xanxia's manipulation from stasis. The Doctor, with Romana, disables the Captain's control, aids the Mentiads, and uses Calufrax's core—a segment of the Key to Time—to finally stop the planet-encasing operations and end Xanxia's reign.
